result.execSummary:
The defendant John W Gemeinhardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be left to the discretion of the Probation Agent.

miscConds.notes:
Court Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Court will grant early termination of Probation after 9 months, if recommended by the Agent.

timeConds.notes: To be performed within 1 year as a Condition of Probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John W Gemeinhardt

records.addlTxt:
50 hours of community service completed.
  **Reviewed by Judge Michael J. Aprahamian on 8/22/17.**
Review hearing on September 11, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant John W Gemeinhardt in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the case to address the Defendant's non compliance with WCS.  The Defendant makes a statement to the Court and advises the Defendant that he has completed the community service but has not received verification from the Hope House. The Court instructs the Defendant to have the Hope House contact WCS to provide confirmation.  The Court schedules the case for a hearing in 30 days.  If WCS files confirmation of completion prior to the next hearing date the court will remove the September 11, 2017 hearing from the calendar.  Review hearing scheduled for September 11, 2017 at 09:00 am.
